channel.title: Torb on Torb Lunde Miranda
channel.description: Recent content in Torb on Torb Lunde Miranda

item.title: About
item.description: Front-end developer and interaction designer I’m a front-end developer and interaction designer. I’ve worked on everything from websites, web-apps, interactive installations to e-learning courses. Experience and education Currently I work as a web developer and designer for Omega 365, and I have also done UI design, information architecture among other things for them in the past. I’ve also worked for Back where I designed and programmed interactive installations, games and other interactive experiences for museums and visitation centers.

item.title: Omega 365
item.description: Omega 365 homepage Information Architecture, Web Design, Front-End Development, Bootstrap 5, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, C#, Appframe I worked on a comprehensive redesign of Omega 365’s corporate homepage, a company with over 1,500 employees from around the world. Here I worked on everything from the information architecture to concrete implementation. I also coordinated with developers on improvements to Omega’s proprietary content management system.

item.title: House of Salmon
item.description: House of Salmon Interaction Design, Visual Design, Front-End Development, Game Development, Unity, C#, React, TypeScript, Android, Java, Capacitor, Craft CMS, Phidgets House of Salmon is a visitation for aquaculture. Here students and other can learn about how salmon farming works and it‘s history. While working for Back I designed and programmed experiences for several interactive installations and smartphone. This included a phone app that allows participants to register points, activate various installations and play mini games connected to various installations.

item.title: Periodic System Wall
item.description: Periodic System Wall Interaction Design, UI Design, Front-End Development, React, TypeScript, Craft CMS, Phidgets Together with colleagues in Back I worked on a wall of the periodic table for Norwegian Mining Museum. This installation allowed visitors to learn about specific elements or groups of them.

item.title: Web-based editor
item.description: Omega 365’s web-based editor Front-end Development, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, jQuery Large parts of Omega 365’s developer tools are entirely web based. I worked on the UI design and front-end code for the editor and IDE used to create user facing webapps and websites. This was also used as a basis for other tools such as a SQL management tool. I also created tools for autogenerating code used both as a learning tool and for speeding up development.

item.title: Using Phidgets with React
item.description: Using Phidgets with React 14. November 2022 Phidgets is a system for sensors, input devices and controllers of things like LED or motors. In this tutorial I‘ll explain gotchas and generally how to use it with React. For the impatient: the gotchas you need to be aware of is: Use the JavaScript library for browsers, not the NPM one. Use hooks to interact with the Phidgets library, as it’s very OOP oriented.
